Package coreClasses

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
coreClasses.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
Represents the game environment of an 'Island Trader' game. Contains necessary Game objects, along with general methods that dont really belong anywhere else
Since:
2/4/21
Version:
26/5/21
Author:
Jordan Vegar and Hugo Phibbs

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEnvironment

      public GameEnvironment​(Island[] islandArray, Ship[] shipArray, GameUi ui, Pirates pirates, RescuedSailors rescuedSailors)
      Constructor for GameEnvironment class
      Parameters:
      islandArray - Island[] array containing all islands to be used in game
      shipArray - Ship[] array containing all ships that can be chosen by player
      ui - GameUi implementation of GameUi to be used by game
      pirates - Pirates object for a pirate attack random event
      rescuedSailors - RescuedSailors object for a rescued sailors random event

  • Method Details

    • onSetupFinished

      public void onSetupFinished​(Player player, Ship ship, int duration, Island startisland)
      Method for finishing the set up for a game. Is called when the user has entered all necessary information for setup, and all objects that required this information have been created. This method passes those objects to the current instance of GameEnvironment.
      Parameters:
      player - Player object for this current game that has just been set up
      ship - Ship object belonging to a player for this game
      duration - int the days the game will be played for.
      startisland -

    • reduceDaysRemaining

      public void reduceDaysRemaining​(int daysPassed)
      Method to reduce in-game days
      Parameters:
      daysPassed - int for the number of in-game days passed

    • sailToNewIsland

      public boolean sailToNewIsland​(Route route, Island destination)
      Method for setting sail to another island in a game. Makes the necessary payments before sailing, then sails along a particular route to a new Island. May encounter random events based on the probabilities of the particular route.
      Parameters:
      route - The Route the player has chosen.

    • calculateDaysSailing

      public int calculateDaysSailing​(Route route)

    • minMoneyRequired

      public void minMoneyRequired()
      Calculates the amount that needs to be paid before the cheapest route available can be sailed. cost is dependent on amount of damage to the ship that needs to be repaired, as well as cost of wages to be paid.

    • getCost

      public int getCost​(Route route)
      Works out the amount that has to be spent before this route can be sailed. Based on the cost to repair the ship and pay crew wages.
      Returns:
      cost int for the total amount that needs to be paid before sailing that route.

    • otherIslands

      public Island[] otherIslands()
      Returns an array of all islands but the current island, representing all the islands the player can travel to.
      Returns:
      Island[] array containing every game island besides the current island.

    • shipDescriptionArrayList

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> shipDescriptionArrayList()
      Returns a description of every ship that a player can choose
      Returns:
      ArrayList ArrayList containing descriptions of every ship that a player can choose

    • calculateScore

      public int calculateScore()
      Calculates a score by dividing profit by days played.
      Returns:
      int for the player's score at time of call.

    • calculateLiquidValue

      public int calculateLiquidValue()
      Calculates the current liquid value of a player in a game (the amount of money a player would have if they sold all items possible at your current island's store). Based on your items you can sell at the current island's store, works out your players liquid value.
      Returns:
      int for the amount the player can sell all his sellable items for plus his bank balance.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Getter method for in game Player object
      Returns:
      Player object belonging to GameEnvironment

      Island[] array belonging to GameEnvironment

      Parameters:
